DOC.brief_summary: An extended replication of Jaen & Dalton (2014), the investigators aim to investigate the role of odors and associated trigger beliefs on symptom perception and airway inflammation in individuals with asthma
DOC.brief_title: The Effect of Odors on Asthma Symptoms
DOC.detailed_description: Participants with asthma are randomly assigned to a 15-min (phenylethyl alcohol) odor inhalation, accompanied by either an asthmogenic suggestion (nocebo), or a therapeutic suggestion (placebo). Airway inflammation, lung function, and asthma symptoms are measured in response to the odor/suggestion, up to 24 hours after odor inhalation. The investigators are also measuring worry and heart rate variability as potential mediators of the response.
DOC.criteria: A physician diagnosis of asthma FEV1 lower than 60% predicted clinical condition other than asthma
